title: Abbatty
author: Abbatty
content: I believe everyone into cryptocurrency is familiar with the term Bull Run and when we hear the word all that comes to our minds is making profit and since the market is moving positively during the bull market some of us tend to be blindfolded with making gains hence acting carelessly but with the appropriate knowledge i think there is nothing to worry about. Scammers anticipate the next bull market and are ready for it in order to con people for profit, just as we anticipate as well but the only difference is that they make profits illegally. During the bull run, there is a significant amount of profit to be made in this industry, but if you are completely new, it's not as simple as you might think. Scammers would want to take advantage of all the money invested during this time and steal it for themselves. Also many newcomers would also want to join the cryptocurrency market during this time after hearing about how people are making money, even though they have no prior knowledge about it. Therefore, at this time  we should expect an increase in fraudulent activities and different scamming strategies when the bull run arrives so i urge everyone to be cautious during this time and not be blinded by making profit and invest with due diligence. My advice for beginners is to invest in Bitcoin rather than taking a risk to invest in alts. However, i am sure they will have their eyes fixed on alts and new projects because of the profit involved. Before investing in new projects or any kind of alt they should carryout proper research so they don’t invest in scam projects. This post serves both as a helpful reminder for others who may not be as experienced as me, as well as an opportunity to raise awareness on what the cryptocurrency market will look like during a bull run. This is the time of profits but also it is the time we need to make use of our head to survive the industry. Whenever you invest, you should invest sensibly and always DYOR.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: It can be hard not to get excited about altcoins and new projects, since they could totally blow up and make you a ton of money.  Gotta be real careful though - with big potential rewards comes big risks. Bitcoin's been around for a while now and lots of folks use it, so it's definitely a safer way to invest than newer coins.  Tons of scams out there trying to take advantage of crypto newbies.  Best thing is do your homework if youre thinking about jumping into some new coin.  How long's it been around? Who's behind it? Get on Reddit and BitcoinTalk and see what people are saying.  It's all about trying find that sweet spot between risk and reward. Bitcoins maybe not as sexy but less likely you'll lose your shirt.  Anyway, just gotta be smart if you're getting into this stuff especially if you're new.  Easy to get blinded by promises of 100x returns.

comments.body: There's one member on this forum who said, "Before you play around with altcoins, always have some bitcoin in your portfolio." I do not agree with that opinion. We all know that there are many shitcoins and also some scam projects whose intentions are only to scam investors and flee, but the truth is that some people have been lucky with altcoin because altcoin is just a game of luck, and for unlucky investors, they will only lose their funds. While investing in Bitcoin, it's certain that the bull market will come, but if you invest in altcoin, you are not even sure if the coin will get listed on exchange or not.
